Description: The disassociation method used for scRNASeq assays
Sequencing read type
Process which results in the creation of a library from fragments of DNA using cloning vectors or oligonucleotides with the role of adaptors [OBI_0000711]
The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. polyA RNA
The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag/end or the full length transcript

A DNA synthesis process that uses RNA as the initial template for synthesis of DNA, but which also includes an RNase activity to remove the RNA strand of an RNA-DNA heteroduplex produced by the RNA-dependent synthesis step and use of the initial DNA strand as a template for DNA synthesis. Description: Unique molecular identifier; added at cell isolation or library construction step. Determines which transcript molecule the read originated from.

Description: An oligo to which new deoxyribonucleotides can be added by DNA polymerase [SO_0000112]. The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. oligo-dT or random primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA
A set of known synthetic RNA molecules with known sequence that are added to the cell lysis mix
Valid Values: ERCC, Other Spike In, No Spike In

Description: The External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) spike in set is commonly used in single-cell experiments for normalization
The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix [PMID:21816910]
A platform is an object_aggregate that is the set of instruments and software needed to perform a process [OBI_0000050]

An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories
defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.
Valid Values: hispanic or latino, not hispanic or latino, Unknown, not reported, not allowed to collect

Description:
Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Identification
of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]
Valid Values: female, male, unknown, unspecified, not reported

Description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation withina a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution.
Valid Values: white, american indian or alaska native, black or african american, asian, native hawaiian or other pacific islander, other, Unknown, not reported, not allowed to collect

Description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.
Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of birth represented as a calculated negative number of days.
Numeric value to represent the year of the death of an individual.
The patient's age (in years) on the reference or anchor date used during date obfuscation.
The age of the patient has been modified for compliance reasons. The actual age differs from what is reported. Other date intervals for this patient may also be modified.
Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.
Text term to identify the cause of death for a patient.
Valid Values: Cancer Related, Cardiovascular Disorder NOS, End-stage Renal Disease, Infection, Not Cancer Related, Renal Disorder NOS, Spinal Muscular Atrophy, Surgical Complications, Toxicity, Not Reported, Unknown

Description: The text term used to describe the source used to determine the patient's cause of death.
Valid Values: Autopsy, Death Certificate, Medical Record, Social Security Death Index, Unknown, Not Reported

Description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of death represented as a calculated number of days.
The number of years a patient worked in a specific occupation.
The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was premature (less than 37 weeks gestation) at birth.
Numeric value used to describe the number of weeks starting from the approximate date of the biological mother's last menstrual period and ending with the birth of the patient.
Individual biomedical demographics attributes
Requires: HTAN ID, Ethnicity, Gender, Race, Vital Status, Days to Birth, Year of Death, Age at Index, Age Is Obfuscated, Year Of Birth, Cause of Death, Cause of Death Source, Days to Death, Occupation Duration Years, Premature At Birth, Weeks Gestation at Birth
